Name: Marguerite
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Nick & Nora glass .
Prepare garnish of orange (or lemon) zest twist.
Review: An equal parts (Fifty-Fifty) Dry Martini with a hint of orange due to the use of orange curaçao, orange bitters and an orange zest twist.
History: Not to be confused with the much later, tequila-based Margarita, the Marguerite is a gin-based forerunner to the modern-day Dry Martini . The earliest known Marguerite Cocktail recipe appears in the 1898 book Cocktails... How To Make Them where it tellingly precedes recipes for "Martini Cocktail – No. 1" and "Martini Cocktail – No. 2".
Nutrition: One serving of Marguerite contains 156 calories
